snippet: The rise in the planet’s surface temperature has been markedly slower over the last 15 years than in the 20 years before that, a circumstance that highlights how much is still unknown about the climate system.
abstract: Justin Gillis By Degrees column notes that rise in planet's surface temperature has slowed over 15 years after more marked 20 year acceleration, even as greenhouse gases have accumulated in atmosphere at record pace; says circumstance highlights how much is still unknown about climate system.
lead_paragraph: The rise in the planet’s surface temperature has been markedly slower over the last 15 years than in the 20 years before that, a circumstance that highlights how much is still unknown about the climate system.

headline.print_headline: What to Make of a Warming Plateau
headline.seo: What to Make of a Climate-Change Plateau
headline.main: What to Make of a Warming Plateau
